data.Name: Amelia Robbins-Cureau
data.staff_bio:
Amelia has a professional background in providing employment services to young adults with disabilities. She has focused much of her career on using a comprehensive set of strategies to assist in improving outcomes for students as they make their transition from the special education system to the adult world of supported employment. She has 5 years of experience providing direct job coaching and supervision to young adults who work in the community, as well as performing job placement, career preference assessment and job skills development.

Currently, Amelia coordinates several projects associated with Work Without Limits, a Massachusetts-based statewide initiative to improve competitive employment opportunities for individuals with disabilities.
